channel.title: Research on Cullan Howlett's Personal Website
channel.description: Recent content in Research on Cullan Howlett's Personal Website

item.title: Building a Cosmic Atlas
item.description: Using telescopes all around the world, I’m helping carry out the largest surveys of other galaxies in our Universe ever undertaken. I combine measurements of their position and motions to study our Universe.

item.title: Dark Matter and Dark Energy
item.description: Dark Matter and Dark Energy form 95% of our Universe, but emit no light and we have no idea what they are! My research aims to uncover these mysteries.

item.title: Gravitational Waves
item.description: When Black Holes and neutron stars collide, they emit intense shockwaves that bent spacetime itself. I’m interested in predicting where and when these events will occur and how we can use them to measure the properties of the Universe.

item.title: Simulating the entire Universe
item.description: Modern cosmology relies on accurate and fast simulations of our entire cosmos. I use the largest supercomputers in the world and AI-based techniques to produce and analyse these simulations.
